etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a cart or wagon): from French charrette, literally ‘cart’; current sense dates from the mid 20th century, possibly with reference to the use of a cart in 19th-century Paris to collect architecture students' work on the day of an exhibition

definitions: a meeting in which all stakeholders in a project attempt to resolve conflicts and map solutions.
shortDefinitions: meeting in which all stakeholders in project attempt to resolve conflicts and map solutions
